raw_entry:
JAMES TREMBLE, 180 acs. Augusta
Co. on a black Thorn a br. of the South
Br. of Potowmack; 8 Jun 1756, p.1. £1.
Fee paid

LEWIS PARHAM, 137 acs. Brunswick
Co., along the Fort Road [East]; adj.
William Johnson, Edward Wesson,
William Randle & John Randle; 10 Jun
1756, p.1. 15 Shill.

LEWIS PARHAM, 516 acs. Brunswick
Co.; adj. Richard Upchurch, Edward
Wesson, William Johnson, Walton &
Sims; 10 Jun 1756, p.2. £2.S15.

JESSE BROWN, 328 acs. Nansemond
Co. on the S side of Nottoway Riv., on
the Country line [N87° W], down Lewis’s
br., in the Spring br.; adj. James Everitt,
Exum Lewis & Richard Williams; 16 Jun
1756, p.3. £1.S15.

JOHN STITH, 1,078 acs. Brunswick Co.
on the N side of Shining Cr; adj.
Nicholas Lanier [the redhead], John
Shell, Pase, & John Ingram; 16 Jun 1756,
p.3. £3.S10. 398 acs. part gtd. William
Stith by Pat. 28 Feb 1733/34 [PB 15,
p.69 a regrant of John Stith’s PB 13,
p.198 of 17 Feb 1727/28] & 680 acs. the
Residue never bef. gtd.

JOHN HALL, 304 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the lower side of Twittys Cr. adj.
Twitty & McGehe; 16 Jun 1756, p.5.
£1.S10. Whereas by Pat. 15 Mar 1744/45
Gtd. Stephen Dewey, then in Brunswick
Co. [PB 23, p.799], And Whereas the sd
Stephen Dewey hath failed to pay Quit
Rents and to make Cultiv. & Improv. and
Thomas Hall made suit & obtained a g.
for the same which he assigned unto sd
Stephen Dewey and by him assigned unto
John Hall.

LEMUEL FENTRES, JAMES FENTRES, JOHN FENTRES & WILLIAM
FENTRES, 263% acs. of Cypress swamp
Land in Pr. Anne Co. joining to their own
high Land, on the N side of the head of
long Cr; 16 Jun 1756, p.6. £1.S10.

CHRISTOPHER NORFLEET, 220 acs.
Nansemond Co. adj. the Southern br. of
Nansemond Riv., at a Gut by the Riverside formerly a landing place, across a
Gut to another Gut, along a path, adj.
Doctor Temble, Jeremiah Godwin &
Christopher Norfleet; 16 Jun 1756, p.7.
10 Shill. 100 acs. part gtd. William
Wright by Pat. 11 Oct 1665 [PB 5, p.464
(565) opposite Wm. Harrisons Landing
place] the right & title is since become
vested in sd Christopher Norfleet, 60 acs.
other part gtd. the sd Norfleet by Pat. 28
April 1711 [PB 10, p.35 at Tuckers
Neck] and 60 acs. Surplus land being
found within the bounds of the sd
Patents. [Apparently this land contains
Old Indian Fields. Norfleet’s PB 10,
p.35 was part of Thomas Hampton’s PB
1,p.422 & p.482 in Upper Co. of New
Norfolk, both dated 1637, which all
referenced the Old Indian Fields.]

SAMUEL BARINTON & HENRY
JAMESON, 242 acs. of Swamp and
Ridges of Land in Norfolk Co., adj. unto
Wilebores Patent whereon the sd
Barinton & Jameson now live, near
Jonathan Methias; 16 Jun 1756, p.8.
£1.85.

WILLIAM SMITH, 63 acs. K. & Q. Co.,
crossing Dimmacks br., in a piney Old
field; adj. Mr Richard Tunstall & Joseph
Row; to a Sycamore lately planted for a
Corer between sd Smith and Row in a
Cornfield; 16 Jun 1756, p.9. 10 Shill.

JEREMIAH FOREMAN, RICHARD
FOREMAN & JAMES GRIMES, 180%
acs. Norfolk Co. adj. their own high lands
at Bare Quarter (Sw.), adj. Colonel
Samuel Boush & Samuel Smith, to a
Juniper (tree); 16 Jun 1756, p.10. £1.

WILLIAM CORPREW & JOHN CORPREW, 488 acs. Norfolk Co. on a
Cypress br. & a Cypress Sw.; 16 Jun
1756, p.11. 10 Shill. 400 acs. part gtd.
John Corprew dec’d by Pat. 29 Apr 1792
[29 Apr 1692, to John Corporoe in PB 8,
p.223, on Sympson’s Cr.] the right & title
whereof is since become vested in the sd
William & John Corprew and 88 acs. the
residue being Surplus land found within
the bounds of sd Pat.

WILLIAM STEVENSON, 200 acs. Augusta Co. on the Bare Spring a Br. of the
Dry Riv. at a place called the maple Sw.,
at the Head of the Spring; 16 Jun 1756,
p.12. £1.

JAMES JONES, 150 acs. Southampton
Co., adj. Benjamin Clements & William
Bowers; 16 Jun 1756, p.12. 15 Shill. [N
of the Meherrin Riv., the Flatt Sw. &
Coopers Br.]
THOMAS HARRIS, 400 acs. Cumberland Co. on both sides of Great Guinea
Cr.; adj. James Allen, Land formerly
surveyed for John Bostock, William
Wamack, & land formerly surveyed for
James Terry; 16 Jun 1756, p.13. £2.

JOHN TAYLOR, 120 acs. Augusta Co.
on the head of a Br. of Muddy Cr; adj.
Wood & Green, John Oneal; 16 Jun
1756, p.13. 15 Shill.

MARTHA MASSIE, 400 acs. Albemarle
Co. on the N side of Pedlar Riv.; adj. sd
Martha Massie, Colonel Lunsford
Lomax; 16 Jun 1756, p.14. £2.

HENRY KEY, 400 acs. Albemarle Co. in
Fendley’s Gap, on Rucker’s Run; adj.
Harmer & King & Company; 16 Jun
1756, p.14. £2.

JOHN BEARD, 402 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on both sides of Callaways Waggon
Road, by a Glade, at his own Old upper
Corner near the head of Falling Riv., adj.
Bolling & Pleasants; 16 Jun 1756, p.15.
£2,

WILLIAM BABB, 294 acs. Nansemond
Co., adj. Joshua Ward’s Orphan, Edward
Moore & Richard Webb; 16 Jun 1756,
p.16. the sd Land being part of 400 acs.
gtd. William Moore by Pat. 16 Dec 1673
[PB 6, p.504 which included sd Moore’s
300 acs. gtd. him 30 Oct 1662]. [Form
Page 3]

JOHN GIBB, 1,195 acs. Brunswick Co.,
down the Wolfpit Br. & the little Cr.; adj.
Ravenscroft, Samuel Wright, Allen &
Hay’s; 16 Jun 1756, p.17. £6. [This
survey is S of Ravenscroft’s Patent which
included part of the Sappony Indian 6Mile square tract at Fort Christanna]

MICHAEL FINNEY, 106 acs. Augusta
Co. on the W side the blue Ridge in the
fork of James Riv.; 16 Jun 1756, p.17.
15 Shill.

JOHN COLLIER, 277 acs. Augusta Co.
on a Br. of James Riv. Called Buffalo Cr.,
at the foot of a Stoney Hill, on a Ridge;
16 Jun 1756, p.18. £1.S10.

JOHN NANCY, 846 acs. Brunswick Co.
on Rattle Snake Cr. adj. Penington,
Leadbetter & Tharp; 16 Jun 1756, p.19.
£4.85,

TUCKER WOODSON, 1,530 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of
Mimikin Cr., adj. Walton & Callaway; 16
Jun 1756, p.19. £3.S10. 430 acs. & 400
acs. part gtd. sd Tucker Woodson by Pat.
10 Sep 1755 [PB 31, p.559] & 700 acs.
the residue never bef. Gtd.

THOMAS LANIER, 415 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the upper side of Mitchels
Cr.; 16 Jun 1756, p.20. £2.85. Whereas
by Pat. 1 Oct 1747 Gtd. Nicholas Sheppard Lanier, 415 acs. then in Brunswick
Co. [PB 28, p.235], and Whereas
William Warthen in whom the right is
since become vested hath failed to pay
Quit Rents & to make Cultiv. & Improv.
and Thomas Lanier made humble suit &
obtained a G. for the same. [Included in
his 838 acs. in PB 37, p.390 dated 20 Sep
1768]

FRANCIS BRACEY, 4,681 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the Brs. of Butchers Cr.
down Sandy Cr.; adj. Baker, Mullins,
Easter, Wilkins, Twitty & Company,
Hawkins, Thomas Wilkins, Thomas
Hawkins, Anderson, Stith & Royal; 16
Jun 1756, p.21. £21.S15. 365 acs. part
gtd. William Hill by pat. 28 Aug 1746
[PB 25, p.202] the right and title of
which is since become vested in sd
Francis Bracey & 4,316 acs. the residue
never bef. Gtd.

JAMES BREADLOVE, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the Brs. of Juniper Cr. and
Stokes’s Cr.; adj. Ellis, Blackstone & his
own lines; 16 Aug 1756 in the 30th year
of our Reign of George the Second, p.23.
£2.

WILLIAM BURDETT, 270 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Snow Cr. a br.
of pig Riv., on the N side of Turkey Cock
Cr., adj. William Owen; 16 Aug 1756,
p.23. £1.S10.

WILLIAM BROOKES, 200 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the E or lower side of
Reedy Cr., adj. Wilson & Mackie; 16
Aug 1756, p.24. £1.

MARTIN BROWN, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of the North
Fork of Terrible Cr., adj. James Wood;
16 Aug 1756, p.24. £2. [Included in his
648 acs. Halifax Co. in PB 35, p.100
dated 23 May 1763]

JOSEPH BILLUPS, 700 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Dry Cr, adj.
Christopher; 16 Aug 1756, p.25. £1.S10.
400 acs. part gtd. Owen Franklin by Pat.
5 Jul 1749 [25 Jul 1749, PB 27, p.255]
the Right and title is since become vested
in sd Joseph Billups & 300 acs. the
Residue never bef. gtd.

ROBERT BABER, 300 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on the S side of Otter Riv.; adj. his
own lines, Talbot & Phelps; 16 Aug
1756, p.25. £1.S10.

JENNET BELL, 196 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on both sides of Mulberry Cr, on a
large br.; adj. Mackness & Martin; 16
Aug 1756, p.26. £1.

THOMAS BOULDIN, 970 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the Brs. of little Roanoak,
at a small Br. of Twittys Cr; adj.
Sullivant, Jones & Dixon; 16 Aug 1756,
p.27. £3. 400 acs. Part gtd. sd Bouldin
by Pat. 12 Jan 1746/47 [PB 28, p.56] &
570 acs. Residue never bef. gtd.

WILLIAM BARNETT & DAVID WITT,
627 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of
the South fork of Goblin Town Cr.; 16
Aug 1756, p.27. £3.85.

JAMES COLE, JUNIOR, 215 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Little
Creek a br. of black Water Riv.; 16 Aug
1756, p.28. £1.85.

THOMAS CLARKE, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. joining Richard Treadaway on
Hunting Cr.; 16 Aug 1756, p.29. £2.
[Regranted to John Clarke in PB 36,
p.579 dated 15 Aug 1764]

DAVID CALDWELL & THOMAS
RODGERS Executors of WILLIAM
RODGERS dec’d, 300 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on both sides of Turnip Cr., Beg. at a
Simmon Tree; 16 Aug 1756, p.30.
£1.810.

JOHN CAMPBELL, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on little falling Riv., adj.
McDavid & McDaniel; 16 Aug 1756,
p.30. £2.

JOHN WADE JUNR., 275 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the head of the Double Br.
of Difficult Cr, adj. Richard Brown &
George Brown; 16 Aug 1756, p.31.
£1.S10.

JOHN WOODSON, 950 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Horse
Pasture Cr. a br. of Mayo Riv.; 16 Aug
1756, p.32. £4.S15. [Regranted to Carter
Henry Harrison—sd John Woodson in
Pittsylvania Co. PB 41, p.176 dated 1
Mar 1773]

MARK COLE, 275 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on both sides of little Cr. a br. of black
Water Riv.; 16 Aug 1756, p.32. £1.S10.

JOHN CLARK, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the Ridge bet. Roanoak Riv. &
Bluestone Cr., adj. Harris & Byrd; 16
Aug 1756, p.33. £2.

HENRY COCKERHAM, 400 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the S side of
Blackstones Cr., adj. Witton; 16 Aug
1756, p.33. £2.

STEPHEN COLE, 400 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on both sides of Storey Cr. a br. of
Pig Riv., crossing Jumping Run & Fox
Run; 16 Aug 1756, p.34. £2.

HAMPTON WADE, 418 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Willeys Cr,
south of Stanton Riv., adj. Jaggar &
Cargil; 16 Aug 1756, p.35. £2.85.

THOMAS WILLINGHAM, 400 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the S side of
Meherrin Riv., adj. Covinton & Nance;
16 Aug 1756, p.35. £2.

JOHN WILLINGHAM JUNR., 450 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the N side of Juniper
Cr.; 16 Aug 1756, p.36. £2.S5.

JOHN WALL, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the Ridge bet. Difficult & Stewards
Cr; 16 Aug 1756, p.36. £2.

ROBERT COBBS, 400 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on the Brs. of Hunting Cr., adj. Cole
& Nichols; 16 Aug 1756, p.37. £2.

JOHN WALL, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the Head brs. of little Polecat & mirey
Creeks Joining a Survey of William
Maclins, in the fork of a small br.; 16
Aug 1756, p.37. £2.

JAMES CARGILL, 400 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on both sides of the Falls Cr,
crossing both forks of the Cr; 16 Aug
1756, p.38. £2.

THOMAS CLARKE, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on a Br. of Hunting Cr,
crossing 3 brs., adj. Stovall & Cole; 16
Aug 1756, p.39. £2. [Regranted to
Thomas Clarke Jr. in PB 36, p.578 dated
15 Aug 1764]

ANDREW WADE, 450 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. in the Fork of Difficult Cr.; adj.
Buckner Stith, Russel, Wynn, Maclin,
Russel’s "Dirt House Survey”, & Brown;
16 Aug 1756, p.39. £2.85.

JACOB CHANCY / CHANEY, 197 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Elkhorn
Cr., on the S side of sd Cr. by the three
Forks; 16 Aug 1756, p.40. £1.

DANIEL CLAIBORNE, 345 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the Head brs. of Couches
Cr. & Tossakia Cr; adj. Briggs, Fountaine, Irby & Stovall; 16 Aug 1756, p.40.
£1.S15.
JOHN CAMPBELL, 416 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on little Falling Riv., adj.
McDaniel; 16 Aug 1756, p.41. £2.S5.

JOHN COLE, 967 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the S side of Nottoway Riv., by a
Slash or Pond bet. the Head of sd Riv.
and Mountain Cr.; adj. Carrel, Oliver &
Mitchel; 16 Aug 1756, p.42. £5.

JOHN WALL, 254 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the ridge bet. difficult & Wynn’s Cr.;
adj. Wall & Maclin, & David Wall; 16
Aug 1756, p.42. £1.S5.

JAMES WILLIAMS, 2,550 acs. Lunenburgh Co. betw. Juniper Cr. & Owls Cr.,
up Little Owls Cr.; adj. Tomson, Nance,
Hawkins, Willingham, Covington, &
Thomas Willingham; 16 Aug 1756, p.43.
£12.S15.

JAMES WILLIAMS, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the head brs. of Sneeds Cr.,
adj. Brown; 16 Aug 1756, p.44. £2.
[300 acs. part regranted to Thomas Shelburn in PB 36, p.657 dated 15 Aug 1764]

JOHN WILKINS, 400a Lunenburgh Co.
on the Brs. of Butchers Cr., adj. Taber &
Easter; 16 Aug 1756, p.45. £2.

MERRY WEBB, 232 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on both sides of Irwin Riv., crossing
Leatherwood; 16 Aug 1756, p.45. £1.S5.

DAVID CALDWELL, 140 acs. Lunenburgh Co. Including the Upper three
forks of Turnip Cr, adj. William
Rodgers; 16 Aug 1756, p.46. 15 Shill.
[Regranted to Wood Jones in Charlotte
Co. PB 38, p.709 dated 14 Jul 1769]

JAMES WILLIAMS, 810 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the S side of Nottoway
Riv., at the Mouth of Hounds Cr., down
the Great Br., up Great Hounds Cr., down
little Hounds Cr.; adj. Jennings, Jones,
Eddins just over Diahs Road, Cocke, &
Thomas Williams; 16 Aug 1756, p.47.
£3. 251 acs. part gtd. Francis Walker for
363 acs. by Pat. 20 Jul 1738 [Brunswick
Co. PB 18, p.95] which upon a resurvey
is found to contain but 251 acs. the right
whereof is since become vested in sd
James Williams and 559 acs. the Residue
never bef. gtd.

THOMAS FENNEY, 115 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the N side of Irwin Riv. on
both sides of Buttram Town Cr., up &
crossing the Town Cr. Crossing the
Mouth of the Mill Cr; 16 Aug 1756,
p.47. 15 Shill.

WILLIAM ECHOLS, 274 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on a Br. of great Pole Cat Cr.,
crossing 3 small Brs.; 16 Aug 1756, p.48.
£1.S10.

STEPHEN DEWEY, CLEMENT READ,
NICHOLAS EDMONDS, ROBERT
JONES & MATTHEW TALBOT,
Gentlemen, 8,000 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on both sides of Turkey Cock Cr;
crossing the main Cr., a Head Br. of
Banister Riv. & a Br. of Pig Riv.; 16 Aug
1756, p.49. £40. [Regranted to Clement
Reade Junr. in Halifax Co. PB 36, p.583
dated 15 Aug 1764]

JAMES / JOHN McDANIEL, 264 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the Brs. of Timber
Tree Br.; adj. Hall, Vaughan, Russel &
Maclin; 16 Aug 1756, p.50. £1.S10.
[For Hall’s see PB 34, p.76 to Stephen
Edward Broadnax, for Vaughan’s see PB
34, p.411]

WILLIAM HARDY, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Crooked Cr,
adj. Ragsdale & Winslow; 16 Aug 1756,
p.50. £2.

JAMES LETT, 190 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the Brs. of Mountain Cr.; adj. Francis
Lett, Clack, Tabb & McDaniel; 16 Aug
1756, p.51. £1.

CHRISTOPHER JOHNSON, 294 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the S side of
Meherrin Riv., on Buckhorn Cr., down

p.51. £1.S10.

CHARLES LYNCH, 200 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides Reedy Cr., adj.
his own Lines; 16 Aug 1756, p.51. £1.

JOSEPH HIX, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on both sides of great Cherry stone Cr;
16 Aug 1756, p.52. £2. [Regranted to
Harry Thompkins - John Hix in
Pittsylvania Co. PB 40, p.514 dated 3
Aug 1771]

DENNIS LARK, 210 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on E side of Dockrays Cr, adj.
Beard; 16 Aug 1756, p.53. £1.85.

THOMAS GRISAM, 124 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the S side of Irwin Riv.,

p.53. 15 Shill.

WILLIAM HAY, 465 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on the Brs. of Bluestone and

£2.810.

HENRY GEE, 275 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on both sides of Stoney Cr., adj. Green &
Robertson; 16 Aug 1756, p.54. £1.S10.

JOHN TALLY, 290 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
on the N or upper side of Pine Cr., adj.
Henry Tally; 16 Aug 1756, p.55. £1.S10.

WILLIAM VAUGHAN, 400 acs. Lunenburgh Co. joining Henry Green on
Buffalo [Cr.]; 16 Aug 1756, p.55. £2.

RICHARD OWEN the Elder, 400 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Reedy
Cr., adj. John Owen; 16 Aug 1756, p.56.
£2.

NICHOLAS HAILE JUNR., 350 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of a Br. of
Philip Finn’s Cr., crossing the Road; 16
Aug 1756, p.56. £1.S15.

JOHN PARKER, 400 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on the S side of Stoney Cr; adj.
Garrett, James Mize & John Parker; 16
Aug 1756, p.57. £2.

WILLIAM TUCKER, 400 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the upper brs. of dry
Cr.; adj. Nicholas Hudson, Wynn, &

RICHARD SMITH, 336 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on both sides of Fall Cr., adj. Powel;
16 Aug 1756, p.58. £1.S15. [Regranted
to Stephen Cocke in PB 35, p.481]
FRANCIS LETT, 325 acs. Lunenburg
Co. on the Head Brs. of Holms’s Fork of
Miles’s Cr.; adj. McDaniel in a Meadow,

JOHN HENRY STONE JUNR., 210 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides the North

JOSEPH GILL, 780 acs. Lunenburgh Co.

ANTHONY GRIFFIN, 800 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Terrible Cr.;

JOHN GILLIAM, 343 acs. Lunenburgh
Co. on the S side of Roanoak Riv. on his

DAVID GWIN, 284 acs. Lunenburg Co.

Colony and Dominion of Virginia whose
name is John Griffith.

WILLIAM TIBBS, 400 acs. Lunenburgh

WILLIAM NANCE, 390 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on the Head Brs. of the

BENJAMIN TURMON, 220 acs.

JOHN ROBERTSON, 200 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Avents Br.,

WILLIAM PENINGTON, 367 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of Stiths

FRANCIS POLLARD, 340 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the South fork of Strait

JOHN SPEED, 237 acs. Lunenburgh Co.

JAMES ROBERTS, 383 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on both sides the lower Sandy

THOMAS SPRAGGIN, 454 acs. Lunenburgh Co. on the S side of Catawbo Cr,

JOHN ROBERTS, 375 acs. Lunenburgh

HENRY ROTTENBERRY, 400 acs.
Lunenburgh Co. on both sides of the

JOHN RICE, 250 acs. Lunenburgh Co.
